intro: Brittonastrum, commonly known as the brittlestem or brittlestem grass, is a genus of flowering plants in the grass family, Poaceae. It is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, spike-like inflorescences. The plants typically grow in arid or semi-arid environments, adapting to harsh conditions with their drought-resistant features. Brittonastrum species are native to regions of North America, particularly the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. Their unique morphology and ecological adaptations make them interesting subjects for botanical study.
